title: The Teaching of the Epistle to the Hebrews serif face on spine of old book
content:
This was the type on the spine of an old book that I need to ID. Can anyone help? It has a lot of Goudy and Garamond characteristics, but the “a” throws me. Any help would be awesome.

(Sorry for the choppy sample - I have the cover type but it is all caps.)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122043704im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/teach_4620.gif)

 [‹ Font from Arkitip's web site?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122043704/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48061 "Go to previous forum topic") [Display face on "Cuba and the Cuban Railroad" vintage poster ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122043704/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48022 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content: Do you have a sample that perhaps has greyscale, and not just black and white? Some of the important nuances about this face are quite difficult to ascertain with the pixel distortion.

Here is the spine unretouched...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122043704im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/teach1_6551.gif)

and here is the cover. Thanks for the help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122043704im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Teach2_6096.gif)
